action.action-desc: Mr. Mast (for himself and Mr. Higgins of Louisiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to permit Members of Congress to use facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs for the purposes of meeting with constituents, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Veterans Access to Congressional Services Act of 2018.

section.header: Use of facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs by Members of Congress

subsection.text: Upon request of a Member of Congress and subject to regulations prescribed under subsection (b), the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall permit the Member to use a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs for the purposes of meeting with constituents of the Member.

Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall prescribe regulations regarding the use of facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs by Members of Congress. Regulations prescribed under this subsection—

paragraph.text: shall require that a space within a facility of the Department provided to a Member under subsection (a) is—

subparagraph.text: available during normal business hours; and
located in an area that is visible and accessible to constituents of the Member; and

paragraph.text: may not prohibit a Member from advertising the use by the Member of a space within a facility of the Department under subsection (a).
